intro: Astragalus ptychophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in poor soil and low moisture environments. Astragalus ptychophyllus is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
